message.content:
Based on my analysis of the provided code, I can see that the `MetadataResources` class is annotated with `@Path("/api/v0/metadata")`, which sets the base path for all methods in this class. However, looking at all the GET methods in the class, they are all mapped to sub-paths like `/versions/release`, `/endpoints`, `/localdc`, and `/versions/features`. 

There is no specific GET method mapped directly to the root path `/api/v0/metadata` itself. The class defines methods for sub-paths but not for the base path. Therefore, there are no parameters for a GET request to `/api/v0/metadata` because no such endpoint exists in the provided code.

Since there is no actual GET method for the `/api/v0/metadata` endpoint itself (only for its sub-paths), there are no parameters to document for this specific endpoint.
